intro: Dithyrea griffithsii, commonly known as the Griffith's dithyrea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa and Lesotho. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or grassy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
